What's awkward is the fact that, for whatever reason, the administration was incapable of persuading people that that was a first-class operation, that they were not torturing people, that they were not hurting people, he said. " Every president has a challenge when it goes from campaigning to governing, takes a while to figure out the difference between campaign and governing," Colin Powell said on CNN's" State of the Union." Now we see at the end of the second year, he is definitely focusing on governing... we'll see how 2011 goes. Colin Powell , who worked in four presidential administrations- most recently under former President Bush - said he expects a strong economic message at the State of the Union address Tuesday. He said the electorate was expecting that focus
